titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Constantine Peter Arnold papers, 1841-1943

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Ann Mulfort January 2013

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

bioghist.head: Biography of Constantine Peter Arnold
bioghist.p: C.P. Arnold was an early resident of Laramie, Wyoming. He was a lawyer, Democratic politician and businessman and the father of Thurman Arnold (Pres. Roosevelt's well-known trust buster).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 17 boxes of legal case folders, 5 boxes of legal documents and 3 boxes of manuscripts, speeches and original poetry. The collection also contains 7 boxes of correspondence (1841-1943) and 1 box of maps, and blueprints and scrapbooks, photographs and printed material. There are also 20 financial ledgers and account books which preserve records of Arnold's business interests.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Constantine Peter Arnold at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was received from C.P. Arnold in 1945 and by Wilson Clough and an unknown donor, 1959-1962. Material was also received from Alice Moudy Robbins in 1975.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The finding aid was encoded by Alexandra Cardin in 2020.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.
